titleStmt.title: Gordon Logan et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10305

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the Undersigned Citizens of Shelby County & also the members of the jury before whome both Cases were tried would respectfully request your Excellency to remit the ^two fines of Twenty Dollars each^ fines Imposed upon Henry C Cochrile at the present Term of the Shelby Circuit Court for the illegal sale of liquor the evidence being that he only sold whisky One time in each Case & on One of the Occasions to a Traveler who Stoped at his house for the night

Gord. Logan Jury man
P W Vandyke " "
Thos. D. Edwards " "
William Duvall " "
George Price " "
George W. Wright " "
C A. Utterback " "
C W Lawson in favor of one "
Lemul Barkett
B D Hamblin in honour of one "
Calet Doyle " "
John B Offutt " "
John C. Cox
W, C, Bullock
James L Rankin
John T Ballard
Jos L Ray
C, M, Hammond
Wm A Jones
J S Roberts
F, W, Brown
T. B & J, B. Cochran
W D Rowland
J. M. Bullock
J. S. Ratcliff
Miller W Parrish
W W Parker
B. Hicks --
Arthur Busey

Shelby Cir. Ct
Remitted
B. M
$200 each 2 Judg } Gaming
Henry C. Cockrill
Iss Mar. 27. 1861
